headline: The Score: Warner, Boeing, Dollar General, American Eagle and More Stocks That Defined the Week
summary: Netflix  struck a $72 billion deal to buy Warner Bros., beating out Paramount and  Comcast  —and shocking Hollywood.  The acquisition would combine the largest global streaming service with the company behind HBO Max, the Superman and Harry Potter movies and hit TV shows such as “Friends.”  Warner plans to split its cable networks off into a separate company before the deal closes.

raw.headline: The Score: Warner, Boeing, Dollar General, American Eagle and More Stocks That Defined the Week

headline: Lockheed Delivers Steady Defense Profits as Boeing Burns Billions Ramping Production
summary: Boeing (NYSE: BA) and Lockheed Martin (NYSE: LMT) reported Q3 2025 earnings in late October, revealing two aerospace giants in completely different financial realities. Boeing delivered its strongest aircraft volume since 2018 while bleeding billions. Lockheed beat estimates with $6.95 EPS after a catastrophic Q2 miss. One Turns Cash Positive. The Other Stays Profitable. Boeing’s ... Lockheed Delivers Steady Defense Profits as Boeing Burns Billions Ramping Production

headline: UPS pilots and company resume contract talks, enlist federal mediator
summary: With fresh memories of the fatal crash of a freighter aircraft last month, UPS pilots and the company have resumed collective bargaining with the help of the National Mediation Board. The post UPS pilots and company resume contract talks, enlist federal mediator appeared first on FreightWaves.

raw.headline: UPS pilots and company resume contract talks, enlist federal mediator

headline: The Week in Numbers: Thanksgiving sales surge, Disney's China record
summary: STORY: From a Thanksgiving holiday sales surge to a Disney film breaking Chinese records...This is the Week in Numbers.:: Week in Numbers:: $44 billion$44 billion was how much U.S. shoppers spent online over the Thanksgiving weekend.Consumers bought up during the five-days from Thanksgiving to Cyber Monday as retail giants like Amazon and Walmart rolled out discounts.The data came from an Adobe Analytics report.It showed spending was up 7.7% from a year earlier and beat Adobe's forecast.:: 10% 10% is how much Boeing shares jumped after a positive report.Investors bought in after the planemaker said it expects higher jet deliveries and positive free cash flow next year.Boeing wants to improve its image after a 5-year corporate crisis involving safety and production issues of its 737 series.The issues have hit its reputation and sent the U.S. major deeply into debt:: $1.5 billion$1.5 billion is how much Prada spent to buy out fellow Italian fashion brand Versace.Prada had long sought the deal and signed an agreement in April to purchase the decades-old firm from U.S.-based Capri Holdings.The late Gianni Versace founded his luxury brand known for its glamorous style in 1978.His sister Donatella stepped down as creative head earlier this year.:: 10.6%10.6% was the sales growth rise for Zara owner Inditex in November.It's a crucial period for retailers due to the Black Friday weekend.It also confirmed a strong start to the fashion major's biggest revenue quarter.One analyst said the Spanish company may have its home market to thank due to the country's strong economy.:: $275.6 millionAnd $275.6 million was how much Disney's Zootopia 2 made in its first six days of release in China.That means it has become the highest-grossing animated foreign film ever in the country.Zootopia 2 made up around 95% of all movie ticket sales over its opening weekend.It comes just months after Beijing cut the number of U.S. films allowed in China due to its trade war with Washington.

after the planemaker said it expects higher jet deliveries and positive free cash flow next year.Boeing wants to improve its image after a 5-year corporate crisis involving safety and production foreign film ever in the country.Zootopia 2 made up around 95% of all movie ticket sales over its opening weekend.It comes just months after Beijing cut the number of U.S. films allowed in China due
